hausheldPage.title: Hausheld
hausheldPage.tagline: Home-help workflow platform for NRW — scheduling, GPS-verified check-in/out, digital signatures, and Entlastungsbetrag tracking. Built with data integrity and EU/GDPR in mind.
hausheldPage.problemText: A 200-employee home-help service in NRW faced manual paper schedules, proof of service on paper, and strict regulatory requirements (GDPR, SGB XI) for health data and billing.
hausheldPage.solutionText: A distributed ecosystem: one FastAPI backend (PostgreSQL + PostGIS), a Next.js PWA for field workers (schedule, GPS check-in/out, client signatures), and a Vite+React admin dashboard (calendar, sick leave, substitute suggestions, budget alerts, SGB XI CSV export, audit log). PostGIS powers distance-based substitute suggestions; a strict shift state machine and append-only audit log support compliance.
hausheldPage.featureMobilePWA: Workers see their schedule, check in/out with GPS, capture client signatures (Leistungsnachweis).
hausheldPage.featureAdmin: Calendar, sick leave, substitute suggestions, client budget alerts, SGB XI CSV export, audit log.
hausheldPage.featureSubstitution: Suggests up to 3 replacement workers by distance (PostGIS) and weekly capacity.
hausheldPage.featureBudget: Per-client monthly budget, 15% alert threshold, CSV export for insurance (SGB XI).
hausheldPage.featureAudit: Append-only log of every access to client (health) data; read-only API.
hausheldPage.architectureIntro: Hausheld is a distributed ecosystem: one API, two frontends. All mutations go through the backend with JWT and role-based access (Admin vs Worker).
hausheldPage.backendDesc: Single source of truth. FastAPI, SQLAlchemy 2 (async), PostgreSQL + PostGIS, Alembic. Enforces RBAC, encrypts health data, writes to the audit log.
hausheldPage.mobileDesc: Next.js PWA (German UI). Schedule, check-in/out, signature pad, client list for assigned shifts.
hausheldPage.adminDesc: Vite + React. Calendar (FullCalendar), workers & sick leave, clients & budget alerts, billing export, audit log, substitute assignment.
hausheldPage.dataFlow: Data flow is unidirectional: frontends only call the API; no direct DB access from the client.
hausheldPage.techBackend: FastAPI, PostgreSQL, PostGIS, SQLAlchemy 2, Alembic, Pydantic — API, auth, substitutions, budget, audit, SGB XI export
hausheldPage.techFrontend: Next.js, Tailwind, PWA — Mobile worker app
hausheldPage.techAdmin: Vite, React, Tailwind, FullCalendar — Desktop admin
hausheldPage.geospatialIntro: PostgreSQL/PostGIS powers distance-based substitute suggestions when a shift is unassigned (e.g. worker on sick leave).
hausheldPage.geospatialBullet1: Worker and Client models store a PostGIS point (WGS84): current_location and address_location.
hausheldPage.geospatialBullet2: Endpoint: GET /shifts/'{'id'}'/suggest-substitutes (Admin only). Ranks candidates by ST_Distance (client ↔ worker), excludes overlapping shifts and workers over weekly contract_hours.
hausheldPage.geospatialBullet3: Result: Up to 3 workers with distance (m) and remaining capacity; admin assigns with one click.
hausheldPage.gdprEncryption: Fernet (AES) for insurance_number and care_level; key via ENCRYPTION_KEY (not in DB).
hausheldPage.gdprAudit: Append-only audit_logs: user, action, target, timestamp. Read-only API — no tampering.
hausheldPage.gdprSoftDeletes: Workers, clients, shifts: only deleted_at set; rows kept for audit/legal hold.
hausheldPage.gdprResidency: Designed for AWS eu-central-1 (Frankfurt); health data stays in Germany.
hausheldPage.shiftIntro: Shifts follow a strict state machine; GPS and signatures provide verifiable proof of service.
hausheldPage.shiftInProgress: Worker has checked in (GPS + timestamp stored).
hausheldPage.shiftCompleted: Worker has checked out (GPS + client signature); cost set for budget deduction.
hausheldPage.shiftUnassigned: No worker (e.g. sick leave); admin can use suggest-substitutes and assign.
hausheldPage.shiftTransitions: Scheduled → (check-in) → In_Progress → (check-out + signature) → Completed. GPS-verified check-in/out replaces paper forms for insurers and audits.
hausheldPage.disclaimer: This project is for portfolio and educational use. Production use requires legal, data-protection, and insurance advice. See GDPR_COMPLIANCE.md.

nexusPage.title: Nexus AI
nexusPage.tagline: Private document vault: upload files and get instant, cited answers. RAG-powered chat with hybrid search and conversation memory.
nexusPage.overview: Nexus AI is a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) application that lets users upload documents and query them in natural language. Gemini embeddings (768d) and Pinecone power vector search; Prisma and PostgreSQL store chat sessions and message history. The system supports hybrid search (vector + keyword fallback), conversation memory (last 4 messages condensed into a standalone question), and multi-modal PDF ingest with Gemini Vision for images and tables.
nexusPage.feature1: Hybrid search — vector similarity plus keyword fallback so specific terms (e.g. serial numbers) aren’t missed.
nexusPage.feature2: Conversation memory — last 4 messages condensed with Gemini before searching Pinecone; follow-ups like “Who managed it?” work.
nexusPage.feature3: Chat history — Prisma stores ChatSession and Message; sidebar lists previous conversations and loads them on click.
nexusPage.feature4: Multi-modal ingest — PDFs: text extraction (pdf-parse) plus Gemini Vision for images/charts/tables; descriptions stored in Pinecone metadata.
nexusPage.feature5: Usage logging — Pinecone query time and AI token usage (prompt/completion/total) logged to the console.
nexusPage.tech1: Next.js (App Router), TypeScript, Tailwind — UI and API
nexusPage.tech2: Pinecone — vector store; Gemini text-embedding-004 (768d) and gemini-2.5-flash for chat and vision
nexusPage.ingest1: Fetch file from URL (e.g. after upload).
nexusPage.ingest2: Extract text (PDF via pdf-parse, else UTF-8).
nexusPage.ingest4: Embed with Gemini text-embedding-004 (768 dims), upsert to Pinecone with metadata (fileName, pageNumber, text snippet).

croatia360Page.title: Croatia 360
croatia360Page.tagline: Premium AI-powered travel guide for Croatia. Personalized itineraries, inspiration cards, and 8-language support with SARA AI.
croatia360Page.overview: Croatia 360 is a travel product that helps users discover Croatia via an AI chatbot (SARA), inspiration cards (beaches, culture, nature, gastronomy), and an explore section for regions and destinations. Built with Next.js, Vercel AI SDK, and Google Gemini; supports 8 languages (Croatian, English, German, Italian, French, Czech, Polish, Hungarian) with react-i18next. Optional Supabase for auth and data.
croatia360Page.feature1: SARA AI Chatbot — creates personalized itineraries; responds in the user’s language (beaches, wine, culture, nature, budget).
croatia360Page.feature2: Multi-language support — Croatian, English, German, Italian, French, Czech, Polish, Hungarian.
croatia360Page.feature3: Inspiration cards — Beaches, culture, nature, gastronomy; each links to the chatbot with pre-filled queries.
croatia360Page.feature4: Explore destinations — regions (Dalmatia, Istria, Kvarner, etc.) with accommodation, restaurants, activities.
croatia360Page.feature5: My Trip — save and manage travel plans.
croatia360Page.feature6: Dark/Light theme — toggle for comfortable browsing.
croatia360Page.tech2: Vercel AI SDK + Google Gemini — SARA chatbot
croatia360Page.tech4: Radix UI, shadcn/ui patterns; optional Supabase

crmPage.title: CRM App
crmPage.tagline: Next.js CRM with pipeline KPIs, role-based access, and team leaderboards. KPI engine, RBAC, and server actions.
crmPage.overview: A full-stack CRM for managing deals through a pipeline. Features a dedicated KPI engine (win rate, weighted forecast, trend), role-based access (Admin, Manager, Sales Rep), Recharts funnel, and a team leaderboard. Built with Next.js App Router, Prisma (SQLite by default), server actions, and Zod validation. Notes are loaded on demand to avoid N+1; formulas live in a single calculations module.
crmPage.feature1: KPI engine — win rate (conversion), weighted forecast by stage probability, period-over-period trend; all in /lib/calculations.
crmPage.feature2: RBAC — Admin and Manager see all deals and leaderboard; Sales Rep sees only own deals, no leaderboard.
crmPage.feature3: Pipeline funnel — Recharts; deal stages from Prospecting to Closed Won / Lost.
crmPage.feature4: Data loading — deals list with include owner; notes loaded on demand per deal; leaderboard via groupBy + findMany.
crmPage.tech1: Next.js (App Router), server components, server actions
crmPage.tech2: Prisma, SQLite (default); Zod for forms and actions
crmPage.tech3: Tailwind, shadcn-style UI (no shadcn dependency), Recharts
crmPage.formulaWinRate: Win rate = (Closed Won count / total deals) × 100.
crmPage.formulaForecast: Weighted forecast = Σ (deal.value × P(stage)) for open stages; stage probabilities: Prospecting 0.1, Qualified 0.3, Negotiating 0.7, Closed Won 1.0, Lost 0.
